reviews.text: We had a great time at Pest Hotel. It's very well located, close to everything, but in a calm place and near a great restaurant (Vak Varju).
reviews.title: Confort and location

reviews.text: Rooms and bathroom are big and confortable, with a great inside garden view.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: Can't think of a better place to stay

reviews.text: Hotel Pest was a real gem within walking distance of just about everything. On arrival we nearly missed it as the entrance is so discreet, but step inside and the fresh white walls and old stone immediately reassure that this hotel is very well managed and scrupulously clean. We travelled in a group of eight and all the rooms, even the singles, were spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms were well tiled and appointed. The propriators were friendly and helpful and fluent in several languages. Breakfast was excellent. The only slight disappointment was that television reception on the one English speaking channel, BBC World, was very poor.
reviews.title: Great little hotel centrally located

reviews.text: We took the free walking tour on the first morning and it really helped to get orientated on both the Pest and Buda side. Highlight of our stay was a ballet at the National Opera House which is indeed the most sumptuously beautiful building. A late evening cruise on the Danube, with drinks thrown in, revealed the magical architecture of the buildings, especially the Parliament which seems to have come straight from the pages of a fairytale. Budapest is, quite simply, a lovely city. When we go back, we will most definitely be staying at Hotel Pest.
reviews.title: Great spot right in the middle of everything

reviews.text: I stayed here for four days and was pleasantly surprised by the very close proximity to the Opera underground stop on Andrassy utca. This hotel is on a side street in a very safe area but within walking distance of many restaurants and tourist areas. Everything else is a short ride away on public transportation. Although this is an old hotel, it has been completely renovated and has a very nice lift to the higher floors. The breakfast buffet is marvelous. WiFi is available in the rooms and there is an internet terminal in the lobby. The front desk staff went out of their way to assist me with directions, boarding pass printing, et cetera. I would return here happily any time.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in prime location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleased with the large room and closet space at Hotel Pest ; plenty of room for suitcases, etc.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.text: Loved the very minimalist furniture; tasteful, new, simple modern lines. Everything is clean and in very good condition.
reviews.title: A cozy and friendly place.

reviews.text: Ask for a room with view of interior courtyard. We were on the 4th floor and I loved looking down into the green area. We liked the greenery climbing the walls and the flowery decorated balconies of very nice city apartments.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The people at the front desk were helpful. We loved the breakfast buffet and asked for cappuccino every morning. Very good.
reviews.title: Just perfect !
Great Hotel, Good Location, Very Clean and Quiet
reviews.text: This hotel was lovely. We stayed for three nights in MArch and it was perfect. Clean, comfortable and well located. The rooms have lovely high ceilings which make it spacious. Breakfast is fine, served in a lovely bright room. I would really recommend staying here.

Central location near Opera House, but in a quiet street. Could walk to most things, incl some nice restaurants. Has a lift. Rooms are huge and kept clean. Bathroom good - excellent shower and hot water. No safe in room but there was one at Reception. Breakfast v good - cereals, egg, cheese, meat, fruit, juice. Staff always friendly. 24 hour access. Could get a wifi signal in Reception (not theirs...), but not in the room.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, central, good value

reviews.text: Most travellers have already described the pros and cons of this hotel at length and I agree with them. It is a nice point for hopping into Budapest center in a surprisingly quiet location with spacious but unfancy rooms. For the price we paid we found this to be reasonable.
reviews.title: Good Location, good value, nothing fancy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we required a non-smoking room and were assured to get one. When we went into the room it definitliey smelled badly (ie like smoke). When I confronted the reception with this they changed the room but expressed their surprise that the room was smelling like that because the first 3 floors were supposed to be non-smoking rooms. I told the guy that I was surprised he said that because there was an ash tray in the room - and there was an ash tray in the room we were moved to. Not sure what to think ot this.
reviews.title: Minimalist Hotel, Poor Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a weekend in November 2010. It doesn't look like a traditional hotel, just a plain door in the street but don't be put off by the inauspicious exterior. Walking inside reveals a lovely, renovated building with great roomy, minimalist rooms, sparkling clean, marble bathrooms and very comfortable. Cpntinental breakfast served iin a delightful conservatory with a range of options, scrambled eggs, furit, yoghurt, cereals, cheese, meats etc.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally placed in Pest, a couple of minutes from the Opera House and so very easy to walk to most of the tourist sites and some great little restaurants. Book tickets to see something in the opera house, it's extremely cheap and you get to see a beautiful building (we paid £3 total to go to the opera) and enjoy a performance.
reviews.title: Very nice, overall

reviews.text: Tip: Having not a word of Hungarian between us we asked the reception to book our taxi back to the airport and were tole the firm they used charge 6100florints. I pointed out that the airport service cost 5200 florints and they were happy to organise the cheaper option for us.
reviews.title: Excellent find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was paid for by someone so I can't comment about the value. Excellent location near everything. Very clean but as has been mentioned, the soap and toiletries were minimal. The Internet service was spotty and I never did know if it was provided by the hotel or just an available wi-fi connection. Large rooms with no paintings or other decorations on the walls. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast is about what you would expect for a three star hotel. My only complaint was the ash tray in my non-smoking room!
reviews.title: a great find ... exceptionally helpful staff

reviews.text: After arriving at the Opera stop on the U2 line, we came out onto beautiful Andrassy Utsa, the "champs eylsees" of Pest. Hotel Pest was 1 block parallel, and about 3 blocks east. The hotel is wonderful. Very hip, modern and stylish. We had a 3 room which was enormous! The rooms were sparse, but modern, great showers, comfortable beds, cable and a mini bar. The windows look out onto a garden that is beautiful. The staff were attentive, and very helpful. Breakfast was spot on. A true joy.
reviews.title: A Little Gem
